site.title: Archit Verma - Software & Data Engineer
site.description: Software & Data Engineer with 2+ years of experience building backend systems and automation tools for enterprise-scale BI migration. Expertise in Java, Python, metadata processing, and AI-assisted workflow solutions.
site.keywords: Software Engineer, Data Engineer, BI Migration, Java, Python, TypeScript, SQL, Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, LangGraph, Metadata Processing
site.author: Archit Verma

personal.name: Archit Verma
personal.summary: Software & Data Engineer with 2+ years of experience (2023–2026) building backend systems and automation tools for enterprise-scale BI migration. Expertise in Java, Python, and metadata processing, translating complex BI models across Tableau, Power BI, and Qlik Sense into migration-ready artifacts. Proven track record in developing rule-driven automation engines and contributing to AI-assisted workflow solutions to drive platform modernization.

experience.title: Product Engineer
experience.subtitle: Backend Development for BI Migration Platform
achievements: Designed and developed Java-based backend utilities to automate the migration of BI reports and semantic models across Tableau, Power BI, and Qlik Sense ecosystems
Built a robust metadata extraction engine to parse BI model files, capturing data sources, schemas, tables, columns, and transformations for downstream migration workflows
Enabled secure validation by replicating client database schemas with dummy data in internal environments, allowing full BI migration testing without accessing production data
Developed a rule-based complexity analysis engine in Java to evaluate report structure, transformations, and interdependencies, directly supporting migration planning and effort estimation
Enhanced estimation accuracy by preparing structured BI metadata for AI models, enabling AI-assisted evaluation of migration complexity and risk
Contributed to early-stage research on an AI-powered BI migration solution using Python, LangGraph, and multi-agent workflows, focusing on automation feasibility and orchestrating report conversion

Collaborated with cross-functional teams using Git and CI/CD to deliver production-ready features, converting Tableau metadata (.tds, .twb) into staging artifacts for Power BI semantic model generation

projects.title: BI Migration & Automation Platform
projects.description: Enterprise-grade backend utilities for automating BI asset migration across Tableau, Power BI, and Qlik Sense ecosystems. Core system handling metadata extraction, schema validation, and report conversion at scale.
projects.impact: Streamlined automated report publishing, reduced manual migration effort, enabled enterprise-scale BI transformations
features: Java backend utilities parsing Tableau files (.tds, .twb) to generate Power BI semantic models
Robust metadata extraction engine capturing data sources, schemas, tables, columns, and transformations
Automated conversion of Tableau metadata into staging artifacts for Power BI semantic model generation
Multi-source BI platform support (Tableau, Power BI Service, Qlik Sense)
TypeScript integration for downstream UI and workflow orchestration
Git-based CI/CD deployment pipeline for production releases

projects.title: BI Complexity Analysis Engine
projects.description: Intelligent Java-based system for analyzing and estimating BI report complexity, transformations, and migration effort. Directly supports migration planning, resource allocation, and risk assessment.
projects.impact: Enhanced migration estimation accuracy, reduced planning overhead, enabled data-driven effort forecasting
features: Rule-based analysis engine evaluating report structure and complexity
Transformation interdependency mapping and dependency graph generation
Metadata structuring for AI model consumption and analysis
Integration with AI models for assisted complexity evaluation and risk scoring
Quantitative effort estimation based on historical patterns
Decision support for migration prioritization and resource planning

projects.title: Secure BI Schema Replication System
projects.description: Automated system for replicating client database schemas with dummy data, enabling full BI migration testing in internal environments without exposing production data.
projects.impact: Eliminated security risks in BI migration testing, enabled comprehensive validation in isolated environments
features: Automated client schema extraction and replication
Dummy data generation maintaining schema integrity
Internal environment deployment for secure testing
Table structure and relationship preservation
Support for complex schema dependencies
Compliance with data security and privacy policies

projects.title: AI-Driven BI Migration Research (R&D)
projects.description: Early-stage research project on AI-powered BI migration solutions using Python, LangGraph, and multi-agent workflows. Focus on automation feasibility and orchestrating intelligent report conversion.
projects.impact: Pioneering AI-assisted BI migration capabilities, transforming manual processes into intelligent workflows
features: Multi-agent workflow orchestration using LangGraph for intelligent decision-making
AI model integration for automated report conversion and validation
Structured BI metadata preparation for LLM processing
Feasibility prototyping for automation scenarios
Cross-functional collaboration using Git and CI/CD
Production-ready feature delivery pipeline
